tweets.text: @JoKingDevon @holnicoteNH @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW That's bloody shocking! üò°
@CooperBeth @EnvAgency You need to use nutrient-free fertiliser, obviously

@JoKingDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW Shocking. Well done reporting it, Jo, and great video. The public are eyes and ears of the EA as resources have been cut so much. Keep the 0800807060 number and, however inconvenient, keep reporting. Suggest you get the name of the officer responding and send them the video too.

Oh god, double whammy - pollution event no2 - pumping  polluted water from crushed concrete into #ShuttertonBrook - watched them doing it. I‚Äôm so sick of people abusing the Environment, seems endless and who is monitoring them? @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW #Dawlish #Devon https://t.co/g9FzlzbLKH
@Biosolids_Andy @EnvAgency Yes even FYM üôà in fact the written warnings even say this applies to FYM and all fertiliser containing nutrients so I have to assume even compost...
@JoKingDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW If they can get away with it, they‚Äôll keep doing it sadly

@BirdygirlDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW I‚Äôm getting where I‚Äôd believe anything now, this is not what you expect in 2021 - just dumping polled water into a stream which flows directly into a Special Protected Area and Wildlife refuge

Into last 2 weeks of @YorkshireiCASP communicating flood risk project. Interviewed 9 flood wardens, groups & community reps in Yorkshire so far to understand issues - but keen to reach more. email: sam.ramsden@hull.ac.uk 
@EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group https://t.co/KOHsVYKfJj

@CooperBeth @EnvAgency Ah soz, Isee what you mean. Do you know if this the case for all manures, even FYM? If the % available N isnt a loophole then I expect they will crack down when biosolids come under the new EPR soon

We‚Äôre continuing to work closely with partners to monitor the flood risk and asses any impact on the environment after the River Coquet in Northumberland split in two and merged with adjacent Caistron lakes near #Rothbury. Read more here https://t.co/yM1aXUoAdm https://t.co/XU69MZg1si

@Biosolids_Andy @EnvAgency I realise that, this isn‚Äôt an NVZ issue.  As per soil&water rules (2018) there needs to be a crop reqt which there isn‚Äôt in the autumn for a w. cereal this is leading to @EnvAgency issuing warning letters for a breach despite the application having a deployment-it makes no sense

tweets.text:
@Spaldingprop @LincsPolice @EnvAgencyMids @LincsCC @SHollandDC Hi Andrew

We get angry about FlyTipping too üò°

Its a blight on our countryside

We need YOUR help to tackle it 

PLEASE report to @SHollandDC - They lead on investigation unless the offender is present (in which case 999)

The same advice as for your find in November üëç https://t.co/Gzk6UVGFYV

@Spaldingprop @LincsPolice @EnvAgencyMids @LincsCC Hi Andrew, as @LincsRuralCrime mention, we're your go-to for any fly-tips that the offender isn't present at. 

Please let us know whereabouts this tip is and any other details you have such as when you found it, we'll then pass on to the team to investigate and clear. Thanks.

@ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @DefraGovUK @YorkDalesRT @Jack_Hirst3 @SandTCUKYorks @jaowallace @Rivers2U_ydrt @yorkshire_dales @wildlifetoursuk @ilkleyIain @PeteTurnerEA I hear they're so mainstream now... you want a few of these instead ;)

Hope all going well! https://t.co/CsM8neolZD

Our Field Team have been busy in #Leyland today removing this big tree from the River Lostock!

Using a motorised winch and chainsaws, the team successfully got the tree out of the watercourse and reduced the potential #flood risk to nearby properties. https://t.co/3Z6I1bH9eR

Well done Feargal, @RichardHRBenyon @GeorgeMonbiot and others for this. Ridiculous that we have laws, an agency and evidence of river pollution but no attempt to prosecute. @EnvAgency leadership change needed https://t.co/oBo6X4tSgL

@GeorgeMonbiot Septic tanks that don't function correctly and happen to be  discharging directly onto the surface of livestock grazing land (also an area open to the general public) is not good eitherü§®
4 years after reporting the pollution incident to the @EnvAgency and it is still happeningüò°
@JoKingDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW It‚Äôs beyond belief.
@JoKingDevon @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW The sad problem is the people who care can‚Äôt do anything and the people who can do something just dont care

Work has begun to stabilise a riverbank damaged after the collapse of a weir at Newlay, near Leeds. The damage has not increased the immediate risk of flooding to local properties, but the works are required to prevent any further erosion and longer term flood risk. https://t.co/DJZkw0Ndxb

I‚Äôve just finished some research about the use of biosolids (human sewage sludge) as farm manure. The results will keep me awake at night. 
¬æ of biosolids in the UK are spread on farmland. The rules about what it can contain are not fit for purpose. Please read and share this üßµ

urls.title: Determining areas of water stress in England
urls.description: We want your views on our approach to determining areas of water stress to inform whether water companies can introduce compulsory metering in those areas.
